title: Cat On The Road To Findout by Yusuf/Cat Stevens review – fame, faith and charity
summary: The artist reflects on her journey through pop stardom and the transformative experience of converting to Islam. After years away from the spotlight, she discusses her return to performing. Her story highlights themes of identity, faith, and resilience.

title: Ministers plan to allow naming and shaming of offenders completing community sentences
summary: Critics argue that a new measure in the sentencing bill for England and Wales would cause shame for the families of offenders. The proposed change has raised concerns about its potential social impact. Opponents fear it could exacerbate the stigma faced by those related to individuals who commit crimes.

title: ‘Hop on the boat and wake up in Spain’: readers’ favourite ferry breaks from the UK
summary: Travel tipsters have curated top ferry routes from Rotterdam to Bilbao. They encourage readers to share their experiences of breaks in secluded locations across the UK and Europe. The most compelling tip will win a £200 holiday voucher.

title: Chad Powers to Monster: The Ed Gein Story – the seven best shows to stream this week
summary: Glen Powell headlines a lighthearted comedy, showcasing his comedic talents. Meanwhile, Ryan Murphy presents a dramatic portrayal of the life of one of America's infamous criminals. Both projects highlight contrasting aspects of entertainment in current media.
